value.name: Michael Mattioli appeals judge's order to release video of fight with Joel Acevedo
value.description: Michael Mattioli is appealing a judge's order to release video of his fight last year -- a fight that led to the death of Joel Acevedo. Mattioli, a former Milwaukee police officer w

value.name: What it means now that Milwaukee has banned police from using chokeholds without exception
value.description: Police in Milwaukee are now banned from using chokeholds, following a unanimous vote by the Fire and Police Commission. The FPC meeting was preceded by weeks of organizing by residents and activists pushing for the ban on a hold officers were not trained to utilize.

value.name: Former officer fights to keep body camera video of off-duty death from being released
value.description: A police officer who resigned after being charged with using a chokehold in an off-duty death wants to keep body camera video of the response from the public.

video.name: Former officer fights release of body camera video

value.name: Can body cameras deliver justice for those killed by police?
value.description: When Joel Acevedo died from injuries at the hands of an off-duty Milwaukee police officer last spring, his parents, Maribel and José, were told their son had been the aggressor.

value.name: Wisconsin cities, police departments implement bans on chokeholds in year after George Floyd's murder
value.description: Police reform has been a focal point and a rallying cry behind months of protests after the murder of George Floyd. One year later, dozens of cities and states have made a major change that centers around the tactic used to kill Floyd.

value.name: 'Remember Their Names' rally takes place in Washington Park
value.description: But Sunday in Washington Park in Milwaukee 14 other names were on display with grieving families standing beneath them. They are the names of 14 people killed by police in the Milwaukee area. Ernest Lacy,

video.name: "Remember Their Names" rally at Washington Park
